page.title: 02FARMS AND FARMING IN OXSHOTT
page.content: {Lower Manor Farm}has over one hundred acres of land. Mr.M of Loseberry Farm, Claygate is a dairy farmer who tenants the land from the Combe Estate. Half of the land is used for grazing and the other half is devoted to corn. He grows wheat for selling (grain and straw) and barley for his own cattle. He lets the Riding School use some of his old barns and a field or two for lessons. In{Upper Manor Farm}fields there are two pylons on a fenced-in plot, where the ground is relatively higher. The very tall one is a police beacon and the smaller one gives aircraft directions to Heathrow. Both farms are in the{Green Belt.
